poem:
Title: "In Pages, A Youth's Daring Venture"

In the margins of morn, a tale awakes,
Of snogging, swearing, subterfuge - stakes high.
Young hands clasp dreams, as a new Bond makes
His unripe mark beneath the watchful spy.
The printed echo of a silent library's sigh,
A decade's discourse in a single glance,
Awakens memories; lost time, a teenager's sly,
In books, we are all granted a second chance.
